decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Amped Raptor and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, supported by powerful enchantments like Arena of Glory and Static Prison. The deck also includes key cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to further pressure the opponent. Goblin Bombardment provides additional reach, while Blood Moon can disrupt the opponent's mana base. By maintaining a fast and relentless assault, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure victories through efficient and aggressive gameplay.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells and removal spells to protect and advance its win condition, "The One Ring". The key strategy is to disrupt opponents' game plans while building up resources and eventually using The One Ring to take over the game. The deck also includes utility lands and card draw spells to ensure consistency and resilience. By managing threats and drawing into The One Ring, the deck aims to establish dominance and close out the game efficiently.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature threats combined with burn spells to quickly defeat the opponent. Utilizing the Companion Jegantha, the Wellspring for extra mana acceleration, the deck includes powerful cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, Amped Raptor, and Guide of Souls to quickly apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes disruption elements like Blood Moon and Static Prison to further impede the opponent's game plan. By combining efficient creatures with burn spells and disruption, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It utilizes powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Devourer of Destiny to disrupt the opponent's strategy and control the game. Karn, the Great Creator acts as a versatile threat and toolbox, while cards like All Is Dust and Kozilek's Command provide board control. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its high-powered threats and efficient mana production.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a barrage of cheap artifact creatures, supported by powerful artifacts that enhance their abilities. By leveraging cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence and quickly close out games. The synergy between artifacts and cards like Cranial Plating and Kappa Cannoneer allows for explosive turns and aggressive plays, putting pressure on the opponent early and often. The deck's reliance on artifacts ensures a consistent and dynamic gameplay experience.

The main theme of this Dimir Control deck in Modern 1 vs 1 format is to disrupt, control, and outvalue opponents through a combination of efficient removal, counter magic, hand disruption, and card advantage. This deck aims to control the game tempo by using a mix of removal spells like Fatal Push and Counterspell, hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek, and card draw/filtering spells like Preordain. The deck also has win conditions in the form of powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, along with ways to protect them.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through counterspells and removal spells, while also utilizing card advantage and card selection to maintain control of the game. It includes a mix of burn spells, counter magic, and powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Snapcaster Mage to apply pressure and close out the game. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and provide flexibility in the spells that can be cast. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent through efficient spells and powerful threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing the card Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast spells from the graveyard, enabling a powerful combo strategy. By generating mana with cards like Lotus Field and Twiddle, and manipulating cards with Hidden Strings and Vizier of Tumbling Sands, the deck aims to play its entire deck in a single turn to either win the game outright or establish an overwhelming advantage. The deck also includes a toolbox of cards like Wish and Consign to Memory to adapt to different situations and protect the combo.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to cheat big creatures like Ulamog, the Defiler and Emperor of Bones into play for a quick win. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to protect the combo. Leyline Binding and Tainted Indulgence help control the opponent's board while Atraxa, Grand Unifier boosts the deck's synergy. The strategy is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures while disrupting their game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to use various cards and combinations to cheat powerful creatures onto the battlefield, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and gain card advantage. By utilizing cards like Glimpse of Tomorrow, Malevolent Rumble, and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, the deck aims to quickly accelerate its board presence and overwhelm the opponent. Karn, the Great Creator and Omniscience provide additional utility and consistency, while Archon of Cruelty and Bloodbraid Marauder serve as powerful threats. The mana base is built to support the deck's strategy and ensure smooth gameplay.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble a combo using cards like Birthing Ritual, Flare of Malice, and Chatterfang, Squirrel General to generate a large amount of tokens and sacrifice them to trigger effects such as Marionette Apprentice's ability to deal damage to the opponent. The deck focuses on graveyard recursion with cards like Unearth and Bloodghast, while also utilizing cards like Warren Soultrader and Orcish Bowmasters for additional utility. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures and sacrifice effects to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach in combination with cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble to enable a fast and consistent combo win condition. By deploying artifacts and utilizing the graveyard as a resource, the deck aims to generate infinite mana and mill its own deck, ultimately winning with Thassa's Oracle or The One Ring. The inclusion of disruption like Spell Snare and removal like Unholy Heat helps the deck to interact with the opponent while setting up its combo.
